description.en:
This is an introductory course that is created for non-IT students. The aim of the course is to give the students an overview of practical information security problems and to teach the students to recognise the problems / threats related with information security. 

The topics are categorized into three groups. First group of lectures gives an overview of ways on how to protect your data and privacy. The second group of lectures gives an overview of public key cryptography and its applications. The third group of lectures starts with authentication and then focuses on different kinds of attacks (social engineering, web attacks, other technical attacks, wireless security and attacks against mobile networks).
description.et:
Tegemist on sissejuhatava kursusega infoturbesse, mis on peamiselt suunatud mitteinformaatikutele. Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda kuulajale ülevaade praktilistest infoturbega seotud probleemidest ja õpetada kuulajat infoturbest lähtuvaid probleeme tuvastama. 

Loengud on jaotatud kolmeks teemaplokiks. Esimene teemaplokk käsitleb enda andmete ja privaatsuse kaitsmist. Teine teemaplokk keskendub avaliku võtme krüptograafiale ning selle rakendustele (TLS, ID-kaart, mobiil-ID, e-hääletamine, blockchain). Kolmas teemaplokk annab ülevaate autentimismeetoditest, erinevat tüüpi rünnetest (kahjurvara klassifikatsioon, küberründed, õngitsusründed, erinevad veebiründed, wifi ründed, mobiilsidevõrkude vastased ründed) ning mõningatest kaitsemeetmetest.

independent_work.et: Homework is given after each topic.

description.et: After each major group of topics there will be a homework relevant to the given subject. All homework tasks together will grant 35 points that count for up to 35% of the final outcome. Specific information regarding the homework tasks and deadlines can be found from the course homepage (not from Moodle).

Exam has two parts. The first part consists of short questions about information security terminology and facts. The second part has descriptions of practical scenarios and problems where the student has to pick and describe suitable tools and technologies that could be used in these situations. Exam gives 40 points and counts for 40% of the final grade.

To pass the exam the student has to collect at least 5 points from both parts of the exam. If the student collects less than 5 points from either part of the exam the grade will be F.

There will be mini tests in Moodle to check if the necessary knowledge was acquired during the lectures. These tests will give up to 20 points during the whole semester, i.e., up to 20% of the final grade. The details about the tests are on the course web page.

Each student will have to write an essay. The essay will give up to ten points, i.e., up to 10% of the final grade. In addition, the lecturers can assign up to 2.5 bonus points for outstanding essays. The contents of the essay have to be relevant to the the information security course. A few sample topics and specific requirements for the essays are posted to the course web page.

grade_preconditions.et: The student has to get at least 40 points during the semester to be allowed to attend the exam.The points can be collected from the homework tasks, tests and from an essay. In total it is possible to collect up to 65 points from the essay, homework tasks and tests. In addition, lecturers may award bonus points for being active in discussions.

grade_evaluation.et:
Grading is done in the 100 point scale. The homework tasks will grant up to 35 points that counts for 35% of the final outcome. In addition, 20 points can be gathered from tests, i.e., 20% of the grade comes from tests. 

Each student will have to write an essay which gives up to 10 points that counts for 10% of the final grade.

A student is allowed to attend the exam only if 40 points have been collected before the exam. The exam gives 40 points and counts for 40% of the final grade. The exam consists of two parts, with each part giving 20 points. To pass the exam the student has to collect at least 5 points from both parts of the exam. If the student collects less than 5 points from either part of the exam the grade will be F.

It is possible to get up to 105 points from homework tasks, tests, and essay. In addition, lecturers may assign bonus points for being active. The final grade will be calculated as follows:

A - excellent (90 -100+ points)
B - very good (80 - 89.99 points)
C - good (70 - 79.99% points)
D - satisfactory (60 - 69.99 points)
E - pass (50 - 59.99 points)
F - fail (0 - 49.99 points)
